item.title: A question on periodic orbits for billiards
item.description: In section 2.9 of the book “Notes on Dynamical Systems” by Moser and Zehnder, it is proved the following theorem as a corollary of the Poincar√©-Birkhoff fixed point theorem: Theorem: On a strictly convex billiard table, there exist infinitely many distinct periodic orbits. Is the result, or a weaker version of it, still true for convex tables?
